reviewText: I love How To Train Your Dragon. I love the silliness of the characters! They can be serious too. I felt like a kid again watching it! I love the shenanigans too! SO many fun adventures that I love watching over and over and over again! With this crew you'll never be bored!
Title: Dragons: Riders of Berk - Part 2

reviewText: Just wish there were more than 3-4 episodes per disc.  Not quite as good as the movie but still entertaining and the characters are just as much fun to watch.  The kids like them too...lol.
Title: Dragons: Riders of Berk - Part 2

reviewText: It's so nice they included every episode from the first season when you purchase Part 1 and Part 2 together.  This is definitely a fun series and has made it easier for those of us who can't wait for the next feature film to come out.
summary: A "Must Have" for fans of the "How to Train Your Dragon" series.
Title: Dragons: Riders of Berk - Part 2

reviewText: Based on THE BEST animated movies ever made, How To Train Your Dragon, it is just as appealing as the movie and carries the story forward and shows the humor and danger in working with Dragons.  A lot of new characters and most important, new Dragons.  The same voice actors for the kids are used and that does lend familiarity to the show.  It's extremely well animated for a TV show but that seems to be Dreamworks plan now.  Both Kung Fu Panda and The Dragon Riders/Defenders TV shows make any other animated TV series pale in comparison.  It's off the air right now because Dreamworks is concentration on the 2nd Dragon Movie due out June 14, 1014 then there are 3 seasons of the TV show to go, for now.  There will be a 3rd HTTYD movie next year so maybe the TV show will continue on for as long as it can.  This series is by far above the limits set for TV shows.
summary: One of my favorite TV series
Title: Dragons: Riders of Berk - Part 2

reviewText: I so enjoy the cartoon of dragons of berk. I got the first season and have ordered the 2nd season
Title: Dragons: Riders of Berk - Part 2

reviewText: This series is a must have if your kid(s) are entertained by the movie that spawned this series, "How to Train Your Dragon" and Part 1 of "Riders of the Berk". Many of the same voice actors have returned to complete the series, and the ones that didn't return were replaced by great impersonators, so your kids (or you) won't know the difference.One observation on this series, the production company didn't spend the money on the new characters. In the world of computer graphics (CG), when you make a new character, you have to develop a 3D model of that character, which is extremely time consuming and tedious. Once the character (or model) is created, you can use that model over and over again. That being said, the characters from the film look great in this series, just like the movie, but you'll notice a significant difference between them and any new characters - which will appear somewhat rough and cheap. I don't think kids really notice or care, but I'm interested to see if others have noticed.Still, this is a series worth owning.There are 9 episodes in Part 2 (2 disc set):Disc 1:ThawfestWhen Lightning StrikesWhat Flies BeneathTwinsanityDefiant OneDisc 2:Breakneck BogGem of a Different ColorWe are Family Part IWe are Family Part IIThe 9 episodes gets you 3 hours and 22 minutes of actual Dragon footage (1 hours 52 min on Disc 1, 1 hour 30 minutes on Disc 2), so you're getting a lot more content than a feature film. This series is a very good deal, great quality and tons of content for the price.
summary: For Dragon Fans, "How to Train Your Dragon", and "Riders of the Berk" Part 1
Title: Dragons: Riders of Berk - Part 2

reviewText: What do they mean "Part 2" and How can they have a DVD of "season 2" when it is not yet released??How about a list of what Episodes are on this DVD please!?!People, listen up: Season Two is NOT out yet, in fact, Season One just recently wrapped up!
Title: Dragons: Riders of Berk - Part 2

reviewText: Most of these are excellent, but they took a tail-spin on the last 2 episodes of the 2nd DVD.  The writer left the humor behind and took a dive into Treachery, Deceit, and Lying...  Just what I wanted to teach my kids!!!  NOTThey need to fire the writer of these 2 (connected) episodes or keep him on his meds.However the episodes before these 2 bombs make the set worth getting for all Berk Dragon fans.
Title: Dragons: Riders of Berk - Part 2

reviewText: PERFECT FOR KIDS. THERE IS A LESSON FOR ALL TO LEARN. ALSO FUN TO WATCH. THE WHOLE FAMILY WILL ENJOY.
Title: Dragons: Riders of Berk - Part 2

reviewText: An excellent movie followed, surprisingly, by an exellent TV series.  I hope the series continues.  Not only have my grandkids enjoyed watching the episodes, but I found I could watch along with them.
Title: Dragons: Riders of Berk - Part 2

reviewText: I am a full grown adult that absolutely loves this story line.  The TV show does not have the quality of animation of the movie but who would expect it to. However, the humor is good as ever and just plain fun to watch.  Well worth the price.
summary: Hey ... it is more of the Dragons!
Title: Dragons: Riders of Berk - Part 2

reviewText: This is a really cute spin off of the how to train your dragon Movies. This is season 1 of the Cartoon network series. All the characters from the movie are there. The twins still dumb as ever. Astrid is tough girl, and the girl Hiccup has a crush on. Snotlout still the tough guy, and Fishlegs the dragon fact expert. The dragons are there, Toothless of course plus a whole number of dragons not seen in the movie.My 13 year old son and I both love the How to Dragon your Dragon TV series. So worth watching, whether you have kiddos or not.
summary: Excellent first season of Dragon TV series.
Title: Dragons: Riders of Berk - Part 2

reviewText: i was a little skeptical at first since i felt that nothing could meet "how to train your dragon", but this series is just an extension of the film and just as delightful.  looking forward to watching them all. thank you.
Title: Dragons: Riders of Berk - Part 2

reviewText: I collect dragons so watched the first of these shows out of curiosity. The dragons are nothing like I collect but I was immediately sucked in by the different characters and the very different dragons. I'm 57 and my sister is 55 and we now own both movies and we watch the series on television. In fact, I bought her seasons 1 & 2 for her birthday and Christmas. The show has a lot of action and the humor is wonderful. How often these days do you watch a show and find yourself actually laughing out loud? We do with this series.
Title: Dragons: Riders of Berk - Part 2

reviewText: Fun, entertaining, good way to pass the time.We enjoyed this DVD plus Part 1. It was a Christmas gift for my husband, who is a total fan of the movie.They're definitely not like the movie, but were worth purchasing and watching with the kids.
Title: Dragons: Riders of Berk - Part 2
